results.title: Afghanistan: threads of life
results.creator_credit: Irwin Dermer and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of aspects of the way of life in Afghanistan. Shows the age old methods of making grape juice, rug making, baking, and salt grinding. Also shows the lifestyle of the camel traders and the atmosphere of the bazaars where the rug and carpet makers go to find the best possible price for their wares.

results.title: Affordable Housing: Dream or Reality
results.brief_description: With changing lifestyles and the enormous cost of buying a freestanding home, this video looks at basic alternative design elements in housing and town planning to accommodate both aesthetically.

results.title: Aetna: a volcanic eruption on the island of Sicily
results.brief_description: Records, un-narrated, with only a descriptive jazz score, the basic stages of an eruption of Mount Aetna, on the east coast of Sicily. It gives a non-verbal picture of one of the most dramatic of natural events, and is also an indirect portrait of Aetna itself.

results.title: Aerial attack on grass fires
results.brief_description: A trial demonstration was arranged at Orange, N.S.W., in which a Cessna plane carrying 75 gallons of water was used to find out what part light aircraft can play in fighting grass fires. Although the test was inconclusive it did show that a small plane would be of no use on a day of extreme fire danger.

results.title: Aeradio: the pilot's link to the ground
results.creator_credit: John Martin-Jones, Australian National Film Board and Department of the Interior
results.brief_description: An insight into the work of the Communications Officers - the men who keep a constant radio check on all aircraft in the air, maintaining voice or morse contact with the pilots, supplying information on weather conditions ahead, giving position, and acting, generally, as the pilot’s agent on the ground.
results.title_for_label: Aeradio: the pilot’s link to the ground

results.title: Adventuring pups
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Young America Films
results.brief_description: A film designed to stimulate observation in the young child, by introducing three puppies, and following their adventures on a farm and in the woods.

results.title: Adventures of two little goats
results.brief_description: Designed for use in primary classes, this film illustrates the habits and characteristics of goats, and shows typical scenes of farm life. Tells of the adventures of twin goats when they set out to explore a large pasture for the first time.

results.title: Adventures of Bunny Rabbit (K)
results.brief_description: Story of a mother rabbit and her very hungry son, Bunny Rabbit, who goes in search of fresh lettuce on a nearby farm. After several encounters with other animals and two narrow escapes from a hungry fox and an angry farmer, Bunny hurries home, much wiser about the ways of the outside world. Designed to teach younger children the features and habits of rabbits and other woodland and farm animals. No other credits available.

results.title: Adventures of a young eagle
results.creator_credit: Istvan Nagy, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Hungarofilm
results.brief_description: The adventures of three young eagles living at the very top of a tree. One is frightened out of the nest while the parent birds are away. His survival illustrates that “learning” is an exciting part of the adventures of a young eagle. Designed to stimulate children to observe things around them, and stimulate creative expression.
